DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Microarray Texture Data Field Group Secondary Source Image java.lang.Long
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens.  Tissue microarrays spatially arrange 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.  Subsequent sections can be analyzed with additional probes.:A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.:An area of database record, or graphical user interface form, into which a particular item of data is entered.:Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit._Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.:Where something is available or from where it originates.:Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

Concepts.definition: A device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens.  Tissue microarrays spatially arrange 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.  Subsequent sections can be analyzed with additional probes.

A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.
An area of database record, or graphical user interface form, into which a particular item of data is entered.
Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.

Property.preferredDefinition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.:Where something is available or from where it originates.:Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Where something is available or from where it originates.
Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
